title: Dad's terror after Samsung smartphone EXPLODES inches from his face while asleep
text:
Dad's terror after Samsung smartphone EXPLODES inches from his face while asleep Ex-police officer David Millar was shocked when he woke up to a fire caused by the charging phone Share Comments By Craig McDonald Scarlet Howes 10:30, 5 FEB 2017 News Dad woke up in terror after his Samsung phone burst into flames (Photo: Sunday Mail) Share Comments Get daily updates directly to your inbox + Subscribe Thank you for subscribing! Could not subscribe, try again later Invalid Email A dad has told how he woke up in terror after his Samsung smartphone exploded at his bedside before bursting into flames.
David Millar, his partner Samantha and his 13-year-old twin boys were asleep when the handset blew up.
The fire woke the ex-police officer who grabbed the device and threw it in his bathroom sink.
Samsung last year announced a worldwide recall of their Galaxy Note 7 smartphones, which were found to be overheating. But David’s incident involved an earlier S6 model.
He told the Daily Record : “Samantha and I were asleep when I was woken up by what I can only describe as an explosion.
“There was a flashing light and smell of burning. The flames burned into a book the phone was sitting on.”
David Millar and his partner Samantha were asleep when the handset blew up The Samsung Galaxy S6 exploded while charging... bursting into flames (Photo: Sunday Mail) Samantha’s S6 phone had been charging on the bedside table when it caught fire at 6.45am last Saturday.
David, of Larkhall, Lanarkshire, said: “I grabbed the phone, took it into the bathroom, threw it into the sink and turned the water on.
“I’d managed to lift it by the side and received superficial burns to my fingers. The phone had been on charge.”
The fire woke the ex-copper who grabbed the device and threw it in his bathroom sink (Photo: Sunday Mail) David, 46, who served with the military police in the 90s before joining Strathclyde Police, said: “The flames shot out in various directions. The fire burned a hole through three chapters of my book.
“The bedside table and the side of the bed, which are both oak, were also burned. It also damaged the bedsheets.
“The bedding had to be thrown out as it was speckled with particles of molten plastic. The fire caused about £1500 worth of damage.
David suffered a lot of damage to his possessions after the phone overheated (Photo: Sunday Mail) “If overnight charging is an issue, people should be made aware of this.”
The couple returned the device to an O2 store in Glasgow’s Buchanan Street and were offered a replacement.
But Samantha, 25, a civil servant, added: “They refused to give us a different type of phone but I don’t want to have another S6.
The fire burned a hole through three chapters of David's book (Photo: Sunday Mail) “It was a frightening experience.”
Samsung said: “There are no known issues with the Galaxy S6.
“Customer safety remains our highest priority and we’ll work with any customer who has experienced an issue with a Samsung product in order to investigate the matter.”
O2 said: “We offered to have the phone sent back to us so we can assess the damage and replace it with the same model if necessary but this was refused.
“We’ll be happy to arrange this again.”
